advanced_report.description: Needs to be used when endpoint data is used for Report by CVEs feature, checks RBAC permission for advanced report.
advanced_report.name: advanced_report

advisory.description: Filter by advisory name, works only with show_advisories=true
advisory.name: advisory

advisory_available.description: String of booleans (array of booleans), where true shows CVE-system pairs with available advisory, false shows CVE-system pairs without available advisory.
advisory_available.name: advisory_available

affecting.description: Comma seprated string with bools (array of bools). True value controls displaying CVEs with at least one system affected. False value toggles CVEs with no systems affected. Defaults to showing only CVEs with at least one system affected.
affecting.name: affecting

affecting_host_type.description: Controls, whenever CVE has 1 or more affecting systems. Value "edge" returns CVEs with one or more vulnerable immutable systems, value "rpmdnf" returns CVEs with one or more vulnerable conventional systems. Value "none" returns CVEs not affecting systems of any kind.
affecting_host_type.name: affecting_host_type

ansible.description: Boolean value which shows systems managed by Ansible Automation Platform.
ansible.name: ansible

business_risk_id.description: Filter based on business risk IDs.
business_risk_id.name: business_risk_id

cve_filter.description: Full text filter for CVE and it's description text.
cve_filter.name: filter

cvss_from.description: Filter based on cvss score, starting from the value. Use -1 to include also CVEs with N/A cvss score.
cvss_from.name: cvss_from

cvss_to.description: Filter based on cvss score, up to the value.
cvss_to.name: cvss_to

data_format.description: Format of the output data, either JSON (default) or CSV.
data_format.name: data_format

excluded.description: Comma seprated string with bools (array of bools). True boolean value displays systems which are excluded. False value displays systems excluded from vulnerability analysis. Defaults to showing only those systems which are not excluded.
excluded.name: excluded

filter.description: Full text filter for the display name of system.
filter.name: filter

first_reported_from.description: Filter for CVEs/Systems where the vulnerability appeared after given date.
first_reported_from.name: first_reported_from

first_reported_to.description: Filter for CVEs/Systems where the vulnerability appeared before given date.
first_reported_to.name: first_reported_to

host_type.description: For filtering out the systems based on their type. Value "rpmdnf" for RPMDNF systems, "edge" for OSTree systems.
host_type.name: host_type

known_exploit.description: String of booleans (array of booleans), where true shows CVEs with known exploits, false shows CVEs without known exploits.
known_exploit.name: known_exploit

limit.description: Maximum number of records per page. Limit/Offset pagination wins over page/page_size pagination.
limit.name: limit

mssql.description: Boolean value which shows systems managed by MSSQL.
mssql.name: mssql

offset.description: Offset of first record of paginated response. Limit/Offset pagination wins over page/page_size pagination.
offset.name: offset

page.description: Page number of paginated response. Limit/Offset pagination wins over page/page_size pagination.
page.name: page

page_size.description: Page size of paginated response. Limit/Offset pagination wins over page/page_size pagination.
page_size.name: page_size

public_from.description: Filter CVEs based on their published date, starting from the date.
public_from.name: public_from

public_to.description: Filter CVEs based on their published date, up to the date.
public_to.name: public_to

remediation.description: Filer based on available remediation type id.
remediation.name: remediation

report.description: Needs to be used when endpoint data is used for report generation, checks RBAC permission for report and export feature.
report.name: report

rhel_version.description: Filters results by RHEL OS version. Automatically flters out systems which are not RHEL or have uknown OS.
rhel_version.name: rhel_version

schema.description: List of RHEL versions. E.g. 7,8.1 will filter out everything which is not RHEL 7.x or RHEL 8.1

rule.description: Filters CVEs or systems by security rule, has two functionalities. If value is false, shows results without security rules, every other value is taken as rule error key.
rule.name: rule

rule_key.description: Filters security rules by its error key.
rule_key.name: rule_key

rule_key_deprecated.description: Filters security rules by its error key.
rule_key_deprecated.name: rule_key

rule_presence.description: Comma seprated string with bools. If true shows only CVEs with security rule associated, if false shows CVEs without rules. true, false shows all.
rule_presence.name: rule_presence

rule_presence_deprecated.description: Comma seprated string with bools. If true shows only CVEs with security rule associated, if false shows CVEs without rules. true, false shows all.
rule_presence_deprecated.name: rule_presence

sap_sids.description: List of SAP IDs to filter with
sap_sids.name: sap_sids

sap_system.description: Boolean value which shows systems managed by SAP.
sap_system.name: sap_system

stale.description: If set to true, shows stale systems. If not set defaults to false.
stale.name: stale

status_id.description: Filer based on CVE status ID.
status_id.name: status_id

tags.description: Filter based on hosts tags. Tags needs to be in query format, that means <namespace>/<key>=<value> or <namespace>/<key> if value is null. Characters '/', '=' in tag values needs to be escaped by url encoding.
tags.name: tags

uuid.description: Filter based on UUID of inventory.
uuid.name: uuid

items.description: Smallest dataset for frontend to work.

mitigation_reason.description: Reason why the system is not vulnerable.

remediation.description: Type of available remediation, 0 for none, 1 for manual, 2 for playbook.

status_id.description: Internal ID of the vulnerability status.

advisory_available.description: Shows whether a CVE has available advisory or not

culled_timestamp.description: Timestamp from which the host is considered deleted.

cve_status_id.description: Internal ID of the CVE status.

first_reported.description: Date of when the CVE was first reported on the system.

mitigation_reason.description: Reason why the system is not vulnerable.

remediation.description: Type of available remediation, 0 for none, 1 for manual, 2 for playbook.

reporter.description: Reporter of the vulnerability, 1 for VMaaS, 2 for security rule, 3 for both VMaaS and rule.

details.description: Additional information specific to the system rule hit.

resolution.example: Red Hat recommends that you update the dnsmasq package

description.description: Description of the associated security rule.
description.example: CVE-2017-14491 dnsmasq code execution with listening processes

more_info.example: For more information about this specific flaw, see its ...

node_id.description: ID of associated Red Hat knowledgebase article.

reason.description: Reason of why rule did hit.
reason.example: This system is vulnerable because it is running a vulnerable package.

rules_evaluation.description: Date of last security rules evaluation.

stale_timestamp.description: Date when stale system becomes stale.

stale_warning_timestamp.description: Date when stale system becomes hidden in the application.

status_id.description: Internal ID of the vulnerability status.

status_name.description: Status of the vulnerability for the application's point of view.

updated.description: Date of the lastest upload of archive taken from Inventory syndicated data.
List of updated objects/updated object IDs.

data.description: List of available business risk/business_risk_id pairs.

total_items.description: Total number of available business risk/business_risk_id pairs.

advisories_list.description: List of advisory names or detailed advisory information

description.example: The bash packages provide Bash (Bourne-again shell), which is the default shell for Red Hat Enterprise Linux...

affected_but_not_vulnerable.description: Number of systems that are affected by given CVE but are not vulnerable.

affected_systems.description: Number of systems that are overall affected by given CVE

business_risk_id.description: Internal ID of the vulnerability business risk.

business_risk_text.description: Complementary text to the business risk.

cvss2_score.description: String representation of cvss2 score of the CVE.

cvss3_score.description: String representation of cvss3 score of the CVE.

description.example: A padding oracle flaw was found in the Secure Sockets Layer version 2.0 (SSLv2) protocol. An attacker could...

impact.description: Red Hat security impact of the CVE.

known_exploit.description: Shows whether a CVE has known exploits or not

modified_date.description: String representation of ISO-8601 formatted date of last modification of the CVE.

public_date.description: String representation of ISO-8601 formatted date of first public disclosure of the CVE.

redhat_url.description: Additional resource about the CVE, provided by Red Hat.

status_id.description: Internal ID of the vulnerability status.

systems_status_detail.description: Counts of systems with given status type.

systems_status_divergent.description: How many systems-CVE pairs have different status than CVE-level.

oneOf.description: List of CVEs for a bulk change.

business_risk_id.description: Business risk ID to be set, obtained by GET method.

business_risk_text.description: Complementary text to the business risk.

status_id.description: Status ID to be set, obtained by GET method.

enable.description: Enable or disable CVEs without Errata feature.

cves_by_severity.description: Number of CVEs discovered on the managed systems, divided into buckets based on their CVSSv3 score (CVSSv2 is used when CVSSv3 is not available).

count.description: Number of CVEs with CVSS score lower than 4.

known_exploits.description: Number of CVEs in given bracket with a known exploit.

percentage.description: Percentage of CVEs with CVSS score lower than 4.

count.description: Number of CVEs with CVSS score higher or equal to 4 and lower then 8.

known_exploits.description: Number of CVEs in given bracket with a known exploit.

percentage.description: Percentage of CVEs with CVSS score higher or equal to 4 and lower then 8.

count.description: Number of CVEs with CVSS score higher or equal to 8.

known_exploits.description: Number of CVEs in given bracket with a known exploit.

percentage.description: Percentage of CVEs with CVSS score higher or equal to 8.

cves_total.description: Number of unique CVEs discovered on the managed systems.

exploited_cves_count.description: unique number of CVEs having known exploit affecting at least one system

recent_cves.description: Number of recently published CVEs identified on managed systems

last30days.description: Number of CVEs identified on managed systems published in last 30 days.

last7days.description: Number of CVEs identified on managed systems published in last 7 days.

last90days.description: Number of CVEs identified on managed systems published in last 90 days.

recent_rules.description: List of recently (14 days) released security rules.

ApiKeyAuth.description: Identity header provided by 3scale (for non-prod testing only).
ApiKeyAuth.name: x-rh-identity

get.description: This endpoint provides vulnerability service announcements. Remain informed about important alerts for the vulnerability service. Announcements are issued by Insights Product Managers and other subject matter experts.
Checks database availability and API response threshold time.
get.summary: Determine the health of the application

get.description: This endpoint helps you determine the numeric business risk for a given CVE. A business risk is a label you can set for a given CVE. Choose one of five business risk options ranging from 0-4, where 0 is not defined and 4 indicates a critical risk. You must call this endpoint to choose a numerical value before calling the *PATCH/cves/business_risk* endpoint.

patch.description: This sets a business risk for a specific CVE. Set a value of low, medium, high or critical for a given CVE. These values are obtained by the business risk path *GET/business_risk*. To set a business risk, you must call the GET/business_risk endpoint first, followed by the *PATCH/cves/business_risk* path.

requestBody.description: Values to be set. At least one of the "business_risk_id" or "business_risk_text" parameters is required.

503.description: Service is running in read-only mode.

patch.summary: Set business risk for a CVE

patch.description: This sets the status for a specific CVE. Set a status value for a given CVE (e.g. in-review, on-hold, scheduled for a patch, or resolved). These values are obtained by sending a *GET/status* request. To set a status, you must call the *GET/business_risk* first, followed by the *PATCH/cves/status* path.

requestBody.description: Values to be set. At least one of the "status_id" or "status_text" parameters is required.

503.description: Service is running in read-only mode.

get.description: This endpoint returns the CVE identification number, description, scores and other metadata. The metadata includes the description, CVSS 2/3 Score, CVSS 2/3 attack vector, severity, public date, modified date, business risk, status, a URL to Red Hat web pages, a list of advisories remediating the CVE, and information regarding known exploits for the CVE.
This is a report of affected systems for a given CVE. Use this request to obtain server identification numbers of all affected servers along with last check-in, system name and more.

200.description: Report of affected systems for a given CVE.

get.summary: Determine affected systems for a given CVE

get.description: This is a report of identification numbers of affected systems for a given CVE. Use this request to obtain server identification numbers of all affected systems.

200.description: Report of IDs of affected systems for a given CVE.

get.summary: Get identification numbers of affected systems for a given CVE

get.description: These are aggregations summarizing your account such as number of unique CVEs, list of security rules, CVEs by severity and more. Use this endpoint to obtain a snapshot of all the CVES and details about their prevalence, severity and other details.

These are aggregations summarizing your account such as number of unique CVEs, list of security rules, CVEs by severity, and more. Use this endpoint to obtain a snapshot of all the CVES and details about their prevalence and severity.
get.summary: Get a macro level overview of aggregated vulnerabilities

patch.description: Use this endpoint to enable/disable reporting CVEs that do not have advisories (errata) for your customer account. If the feature is disabled, CVEs without advisories will be hidden in outputs of all endpoints.

200.description: CVEs without Errata feature successfully updated.

patch.summary: Set a feature flag for CVEs without errata

delete.description: Use this endpoint for restarting your already obtained notifications for CVEs.
delete.summary: Delete already sent notifications for CVEs

get.description: This returns an Ansible playbook template for a given rule identification number. Use this endpoint to return an Ansible playbook template for a given rule error key. The template is used to remediate issues on your system.

404.description: Given rule id does not exist.

get.summary: Get an Ansible Playbook template for CVEs with security rules

get.description: This returns an overview of vulnerabilities affecting a given account. Use this request when you need to download a high-level, executive report summarizing the security exposure of your infrastructure. These reports are designed for an executive audience and include data such as the number of RHEL systems analyzed, the number of security rules in your infrastructure, percentage of CVEs with a certain severity and more.

This endpoint returns a list of possible values for setting status for a CVE or system-CVE pair. Call this api when you want to know which values are available for setting a status. A list of numbers will be returned. You must call this endpoint before calling the *PATCH/cves/status* endpoint.

patch.description: This endpoint sets status for given systems and CVEs. Use this endpoint when you need to set a status value for system-CVE pairs.

503.description: Service is running in read-only mode.

get.description: List systems that are accessible when you are logged into your account. Use this endpoint to view basic system attributes such as display name and system type.
This lists systems including those that have opted out of the current query. Use this when you do not want to see a registered system or systems in your reports.
get.summary: List systems identification numbers along with opt out state

patch.description: Opt a specific system in or out of vulnerability analysis. Use this when you want to use other Insights services but do not want to see specific systems in vulnerability reports. This allows you to hide select systems.

503.description: Service is running in read-only mode.

patch.summary: Opt a system in or out of the vulnerability service

get.description: This allows you to get information about systems related to an inventory identification number. This includes details such as operating system, inventory tags, last update, opt-out status, and more.

404.description: System has not been found in the database.

get.description: This endpoint displays detailed information about all CVEs for which a system is exposed. Use this endpoint to discover which CVEs are affecting a given system. CVE metadata is included.

404.description: System has not been found in the database.

get.summary: Get a CVE report for a system

get.description: This endpoint displays identification numbers of all CVEs for which a system is exposed. Use this endpoint to learn which CVEs are affecting a given system.

404.description: System has not been found in the database.

get.summary: Get a CVE identification number report for a system

get.description: This endpoint will provide you with the application version. Use this endpoint to track application changes.

This provides an overview of vulnerabilities across your entire system inventory. Use this endpoint to get an overview of which CVEs are affecting your account, including some CVE metadata, how many systems are affected by each CVE, and more.

post.description: This is an overview of vulnerabilities for specific CVEs provided in the body. Use this endpoint to get a CVSS score, and learn the severity for a list of CVEs provided in the request.

requestBody.description: List of CVEs to provide info about.

get.description: This is an overview of vulnerabilities identification numbers across your entire system inventory. Use this endpoint to get an overview of which CVEs are affecting your account.
get.summary: Get an overview of Vulnerabilities' identification numbers
